query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 Tant’ eran li occhi miei fissi e attenti 2 a disbramarsi la decenne sete, 3 che li altri sensi m’eran tutti spenti.
query.error: **English:** 1 So fixed and intent were my eyes 2 in satisfying their ten-year thirst, 3 that all my other senses were extinguished.
query.result: 1 Tāvān eva me cakṣuṣī niścite ca āstām 2 daśavarṣīṇīṃ tṛṣṇāṃ nirasitum, 3 anye tu sarve me indriyāḥ praṇāśam āgatāḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
4 Ed essi quinci e quindi avien parete 5 di non caler—così lo santo riso 6 a sé traéli con l’antica rete!—;
query.error: **English:** 4 And they on this side and that made a wall 5 of not coming any farther—so the holy laughter 6 drew them to itself with the ancient net!—;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
7 quando per forza mi fu vòlto il viso 8 ver’ la sinistra mia da quelle dee, 9 perch’ io udi’ da loro un «Troppo fiso!»;
query.error: **English:** 7 when by force my face was turned 8 toward my left by those goddesses, 9 because I heard from them a “Too intently!”;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 e la disposizion ch’a veder èe 11 ne li occhi pur testé dal sol percossi, 12 sanza la vista alquanto esser mi fée.
query.error: **English:** 10 and the disposition that is to be seen 11 in the eyes just then struck by the sun, 12 made me somewhat lose my sight.
query.result: 10 ca pravṛttiḥ yā draṣṭavyā 11 netrayoḥ eva adhunā eva sūryeṇa āhataḥ, 12 dṛṣṭiḥ vinā kaścit kālaḥ mama abhavat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 Ma poi ch’al poco il viso riformossi 14 (e dico ‘al poco’ per rispetto al molto 15 sensibile onde a forza mi rimossi),
query.error: **English:** 13 But when I had somewhat recovered my vision 14 (and I say “somewhat” in comparison to the much 15 light from which I had perforce withdrawn),
query.result: 13 Api ca tataḥ kaścid alpam eva darśanam punar alabhata 14 (evaṃ ca “alpam” iti aham bruve bahutaram ādarāya), 15 yasya tejasaḥ balātkāram aham nivṛttaḥ āsīt,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 vidi ’n sul braccio destro esser rivolto 17 lo glorïoso essercito, e tornarsi 18 col sole e con le sette fiamme al volto.
query.error: **English:** 16 I saw on my right arm the glorious host 17 turning, and returning with the sun and the seven flames in front of them.
query.result: 16 tadā aham adṛkṣam dakṣiṇe bhuje vartata iti 17 yaśasvinī senā, sā ca punar āvartata iti 18 sūryeṇa saha sapta ca jvālāḥ mukhe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
19 Come sotto li scudi per salvarsi 20 volgesi schiera, e sé gira col segno, 21 prima che possa tutta in sé mutarsi;
query.error: **English:** 19 As under shields to save themselves 20 a squadron turns, and wheels with its ensign, 21 before it can all change front;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 quella milizia del celeste regno 23 che procedeva, tutta trapassonne 24 pria che piegasse il carro il primo legno.
query.error: **English:** 22 that soldiery of the celestial kingdom 23 which was advancing, passed all through 24 before the chariot had moved the first timber.
query.result: 22 sa devānāṃ senā, 23 yā agre āgacchat, 24 sarvā eva tatra atiriktā,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 Indi a le rote si tornar le donne, 26 e ’l grifon mosse il benedetto carco 27 sì, che però nulla penna crollonne.
query.error: **English:** 25 Then the ladies turned to their wheels, 26 and the griffin moved the blessed burden 27 so that not a single feather shook.
query.result: 25 Tataḥ strīyaḥ svakarmaṇi pravṛttāḥ, 26 gṛdhrarājaḥ ca puṇyabhāraṃ bibharti sma, 27 yathā tasya na kevalamekaṃ pakṣamapi na calati sma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
28 La bella donna che mi trasse al varco 29 e Stazio e io seguitavam la rota 30 che fé l’orbita sua con minore arco.
query.error: **English:** 28 The beautiful lady who had led me to the pass, 29 and Statius and I followed the path 30 that made its orbit with a smaller arc.
query.result: 28 Ya sundarī ya mama vargam prati nītavān, 29 Staziaśca aham ca anugacchāvaḥ panthānam, 30 Yaḥ panthāḥ apanīyaṃ cakram kṛtvā alpa-vṛttaḥ abhavat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
31 Sì passeggiando l’alta selva vòta, 32 colpa di quella ch’al serpente crese, 33 temprava i passi un’angelica nota.
query.error: **English:** 31 Thus wandering through the deep deserted wood, 32 the fault of her who trusted the serpent, 33 an angelic sound tempered my steps.
query.result: 31 Evam gacchantam gahanaṃ vanam śūnyam, 32 tasyaivāparādhaṃ yasya sarpaṃ viśvaste, 33 devadūta-gītam mṛdu mṛdu vikramān samādhārayām āsa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
34 Forse in tre voli tanto spazio prese 35 disfrenata saetta, quanto eramo 36 rimossi, quando Bëatrice scese.
query.error: **English:** 34 Perhaps in three flights of an arrow 35 a wild bolt of lightning would have covered 36 as much space as we traveled when Beatrice descended.
query.result: 34 Triṣu pataneṣu kimciddeśamapi 35 ajāmi vidyud yāvatpramāṇamākramet, 36 tāvatpramāṇamākramyatām mayā, yadā Bēatrice avatīrṇā.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 Io senti’ mormorare a tutti «Adamo»; 38 poi cerchiaro una pianta dispogliata 39 di foglie e d’altra fronda in ciascun ramo.
query.error: **English:** 37 I heard everyone murmur "Adam"; 38 then I noticed a tree stripped 39 of leaves and other foliage on every branch.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
40 La coma sua, che tanto si dilata 41 più quanto più è sù, fora da l’Indi 42 ne’ boschi lor per altezza ammirata.
query.error: **English:** 40 Its crown, which spreads out so wide 41 the higher it is, would be admired 42 in the forests of India for its height.
query.result: 40 Tasyāgre śikhā yāvatī vistīrṇā 41 Tāvatī adhastād adhikaṃ viśeṣataḥ, 42 Yā bhārata-vana-maṇḍaleṣu viśrutā.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
43 «Beato se’, grifon, che non discindi 44 col becco d’esto legno dolce al gusto, 45 poscia che mal si torce il ventre quindi».
query.error: **English:** 43 Blessed are you, griffin, who do not tear 44 with your beak this wood that is sweet to the taste, 45 since the belly is then twisted badly from it.
query.result: 43 Dhanyastvamasi, gṛdhrarāja, yaḥ na vihinasya 44 Asya kāṣṭhasya madhurasvādasya tuṇḍena, 45 Anantaram hi kuṭilaṃ bhavati tatra udaram.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
46 Così dintorno a l’albero robusto 47 gridaron li altri; e l’animal binato: 48 «Sì si conserva il seme d’ogne giusto».
query.error: **English:** 46 Thus around the sturdy tree 47 the others cried out; and the two-formed beast: 48 "Yes, thus is preserved the seed of every just man."
query.result: 46 Evam vṛkṣasya paritaḥ sthūlasya 47 Ruruvur anye; mṛgaś ca dvidhātmā: 48 "Evaṃ dhāryate sarvasya dharmātmanaḥ bījam."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
49 E vòlto al temo ch’elli avea tirato, 50 trasselo al piè de la vedova frasca, 51 e quel di lei a lei lasciò legato.
query.error: **English:** 49 And turning to the shaft which he had drawn, 50 he dragged it to the foot of the widowed bush, 51 and left it tied to her, to her.
query.result: 49 Tataśca tena ākrṣṭaṃ śaraṃ prati, 50 Vidhavāyāḥ śākhāyāḥ pāde tasya nyavedayat, 51 Tasyāśca tasyāṃ tasya bandhanam cakāra.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
52 Come le nostre piante, quando casca 53 giù la gran luce mischiata con quella 54 che raggia dietro a la celeste lasca,
query.error: **English:** 52 As our plants, when the great light falls 53 down mingled with that which rays behind 54 the celestial slab,
query.result: 52 Yathā asmākaṃ vṛkṣāḥ, yadā patati 53 adhaḥ mahat prakāśaḥ miśritaḥ tena 54 yaḥ raśmayaḥ paścāt divyasya śilāpaṭṭasya,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
55 turgide fansi, e poi si rinovella 56 di suo color ciascuna, pria che ’l sole 57 giunga li suoi corsier sotto altra stella;
query.error: **English:** 55 grow turgid and then each one renews 56 its color, before the sun 57 yokes his steeds beneath another star;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
58 men che di rose e più che di vïole 59 colore aprendo, s’innovò la pianta, 60 che prima avea le ramora sì sole.
query.error: **English:** 58 less than roses and more than violets 59 in color, the plant renewed itself, 60 which before had its branches so bare.
query.result: 58 apēkṣayā rakta-puṣpāṇām adhikaṃ ca apēkṣayā nīla-puṣpāṇām 59 varṇam bibhratī, punar navīkṛtā abhavat vṛkṣaḥ, 60 yaḥ pūrvam evaṃ śākhāḥ evaikakīḥ āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
61 Io non lo ’ntesi, né qui non si canta 62 l’inno che quella gente allor cantaro, 63 né la nota soffersi tutta quanta.
query.error: **English:** 61 I did not understand it, nor is it sung here, 62 the hymn that those people sang then, 63 nor did I endure the entire melody.
query.result: 61 Aham tat na śuśrāva, na ca atra gīyate, 62 stutiḥ yām tāḥ prajāḥ tadā jaguḥ, 63 na ca tāṃ sarvām śrutim asahiṣṇuḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 S’io potessi ritrar come assonnaro 65 li occhi spietati udendo di Siringa, 66 li occhi a cui pur vegghiar costò sì caro;
query.error: **English:** 64 If I could portray how I fell asleep 65 hearing the pitiless eyes of Syrinx, 66 the eyes for which staying awake cost so dearly;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
67 come pintor che con essempro pinga, 68 disegnerei com’ io m’addormentai; 69 ma qual vuol sia che l’assonnar ben finga.
query.error: **English:** 67 like a painter who paints with a model, 68 I would depict how I fell asleep; 69 but whoever wants to can imagine it well.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 Però trascorro a quando mi svegliai, 71 e dico ch’un splendor mi squarciò ’l velo 72 del sonno, e un chiamar: «Surgi: che fai?».
query.error: **English:** 70 But I pass on to when I awoke, 71 and I say that a splendor tore open the veil 72 of sleep, and a voice called: "Rise! What are you doing?"
query.result: 70 Tathāpi tadāgataḥasmi yadā prabuddho 'bhavam, 71 evam ca bruve ya ekaḥ prakāśaḥ chinatti mama āvaraṇam, 72 nidrāyāś ca āhvānaṃ: "Uttiṣṭha kim karomi?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
73 Quali a veder de’ fioretti del melo 74 che del suo pome li angeli fa ghiotti 75 e perpetüe nozze fa nel cielo,
query.error: **English:** 73 Like seeing the little flowers of the apple tree 74 that make the angels greedy for its fruit 75 and celebrate perpetual nuptials in heaven,
query.result: 73 Yathā apy āmalakī-puṣpāṇi dṛṣṭvā 74 yasya phalān abhilāṣiṇaḥ devāḥ 75 svarge nityam vivāham ācaranti,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
76 Pietro e Giovanni e Iacopo condotti 77 e vinti, ritornaro a la parola 78 da la qual furon maggior sonni rotti,
query.error: **English:** 76 Peter and John and James, led 77 and overcome, returned to the word 78 by which greater slumbers were broken,
query.result: 76 tathā Pītarau ca Yaḥpauś ca Yākūbaś ca 77 nītāḥ jitāś ca pratyājagmuḥ tad-vacanam 78 yena bhagavān niśānta-nidrāḥ prabodhitaḥ,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
79 e videro scemata loro scuola 80 così di Moïsè come d’Elia, 81 e al maestro suo cangiata stola;
query.error: **English:** 79 and they saw their company diminished 80 of both Moses and Elijah, 81 and their master's garment changed;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
82 tal torna’ io, e vidi quella pia 83 sovra me starsi che conducitrice 84 fu de’ miei passi lungo ’l fiume pria.
query.error: **English:** 82 thus I returned, and I saw that pious one 83 standing over me, who was the guide 84 of my steps along the river before.
query.result: 82 tathā aham api pratyājagām, dṛṣṭavānś ca tām bhaktim 83 mayy utthitām yā pūrvaṃ nadī-tīre 84 mama padayoḥ praṇayinī āgamanikā āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 E tutto in dubbio dissi: «Ov’ è Beatrice?». 86 Ond’ ella: «Vedi lei sotto la fronda 87 nova sedere in su la sua radice.
query.error: **English:** 85 And all in doubt I said: "Where is Beatrice?" 86 Then she: "See her beneath the new foliage 87 sitting on the root of the tree."
query.result: 85 Sarvaṃ ca saṃśaye 'bravam: "Kvaiva Bhāratī?" 86 Tatra sā: "Paśya tām nava-pallava-tale 87 Nīcāyām āsīnam mūle vṛkṣasya."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
88 Vedi la compagnia che la circonda: 89 li altri dopo ’l grifon sen vanno suso 90 con più dolce canzone e più profonda».
query.error: **English:** 88 See the company that surrounds her: 89 the others, following the griffin, go up 90 with a sweeter and deeper song.
query.result: 88 Paśya saṅghaṃ yaḥ tāṃ parivartayate: 89 Apare gṛdhrarājaṃ prāpya ūrdhvaṃ gacchanti 90 Madhuratareṇa gambhīyamsena ca gītena.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
91 E se più fu lo suo parlar diffuso, 92 non so, però che già ne li occhi m’era 93 quella ch’ad altro intender m’avea chiuso.
query.error: **English:** 91 And if his speech was more diffuse, 92 I do not know, but already in my eyes was 93 she who had closed me to understanding anything else.
query.result: 91 Api ca yadi tadīyaṃ vakyaṃ vistīrṇataram āsīt, 92 na jānāmi, tathāpi mama netrayoḥ samīpe āsīt, 93 sā yā mama anyad api jñātum avarudhat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
94 Sola sedeasi in su la terra vera, 95 come guardia lasciata lì del plaustro 96 che legar vidi a la biforme fera.
query.error: **English:** 94 You alone sit on the true earth, 95 like a guard left there of the chariot 96 that I saw yoked to the two-formed beast.
query.result: 94 Ekā tvam sthitā asi satyām pṛthivyām, 95 Yathā rakṣikā tatra sthāpitā ratasya, 96 Yaṃ dvyaṅgajantavaheṇa yuktaṃ adṛkṣam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
97 In cerchio le facevan di sé claustro 98 le sette ninfe, con quei lumi in mano 99 che son sicuri d’Aquilone e d’Austro.
query.error: **English:** 97 In a circle the seven nymphs made a cloister of themselves, 98 with those lights in their hands 99 that are safe from the north wind and the south wind.
query.result: 97 Maṇḍale tāḥ sapta apsarasaḥ ātmānaṃ parikṣipya āvaraṇam cakruḥ, 98 hastayoḥ dīpāḥ āsann eṣām, 99 ye uttara-vāyoh dakṣiṇa-vāyoś ca abhayāḥ santi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
100 «Qui sarai tu poco tempo silvano; 101 e sarai meco sanza fine cive 102 di quella Roma onde Cristo è romano.
query.error: **English:** 100 "Here you will be a dweller of the woods for a short time; 101 and you will be a citizen with me without end 102 of that Rome where Christ is a Roman."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
103 Però, in pro del mondo che mal vive, 104 al carro tieni or li occhi, e quel che vedi, 105 ritornato di là, fa che tu scrive».
query.error: **English:** 103 But, for the sake of the world that lives in evil, 104 keep your eyes on the chariot now, and what you see, 105 when you return from there, make sure you write down.
query.result: 103 Tathāpi, lokasya ye durācāraḥ, 104 tasya hitāya tvam adhunā ratham avalokayasva, tatra ca yat paśyasi, 105 tat tataḥ pratyāgataḥ likhitvāṃ kuru.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
106 Così Beatrice; e io, che tutto ai piedi 107 d’i suoi comandamenti era divoto, 108 la mente e li occhi ov’ ella volle diedi.
query.error: **English:** 106 Thus Beatrice; and I, who was devoted at the feet 107 of her commands, 108 turned my mind and eyes where she wished.
query.result: 106 Evamuvāca Beatrikā; aham tu sarvam 107 asyāḥ samādīnāmūrdhni nītvā, 108 manaścakṣuṣī ca yatra sā icchati tatra dadau.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 Non scese mai con sì veloce moto 110 foco di spessa nube, quando piove 111 da quel confine che più va remoto,
query.error: **English:** 109 Never did fire descend with such swift motion 110 from a thick cloud, when it rains 111 from that boundary which is farthest removed,
query.result: 109 Na kadācid api jaghana tathā tvarayā 110 vahner bahulāyā meghāyāṃ varsati 111 tataḥ sīmāt yaḥ atiriktaḥ vartate,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
112 com’ io vidi calar l’uccel di Giove 113 per l’alber giù, rompendo de la scorza, 114 non che d’i fiori e de le foglie nove;
query.error: **English:** 112 as I saw the bird of Jove descend 113 down through the tree, breaking through the bark, 114 not just of the flowers and the new leaves;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
115 e ferì ’l carro di tutta sua forza; 116 ond’ el piegò come nave in fortuna, 117 vinta da l’onda, or da poggia, or da orza.
query.error: **English:** 115 and it struck the chariot with all its force; 116 whereupon it tilted like a ship in a storm, 117 overcome by the waves, now on the starboard, now on the larboard side.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
118 Poscia vidi avventarsi ne la cuna 119 del trïunfal veiculo una volpe 120 che d’ogne pasto buon parea digiuna;
query.error: **English:** 118 Then I saw a fox rush into the cradle 119 of the triumphal chariot, 120 which seemed to be fasting from every good food;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
121 ma, riprendendo lei di laide colpe, 122 la donna mia la volse in tanta futa 123 quanto sofferser l’ossa sanza polpe.
query.error: **English:** 121 but, rebuking her for her ugly sins, 122 my lady put her to flight 123 as much as bones without flesh can suffer.
query.result: 121 tām tu nindantīm duritāni, 122 mama svāminī tām tāvad dūre apasārayām āsa 123 yāvad aस्थि-चर्म-mātram eva śeṣam abhavat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
124 Poscia per indi ond’ era pria venuta, 125 l’aguglia vidi scender giù ne l’arca 126 del carro e lasciar lei di sé pennuta;
query.error: **English:** 124 Then, by the way I had come before, 125 I saw the eagle descend into the ark 126 of the chariot and leave it abandoned;
query.result: 124 Tataḥ yena mārgeṇa pūrvam āgataḥ āsam, 125 śakunaṃ adṛkṣam avatīrṇam adhastāt ratha-śakaṭasya, 126 tasya ca śakaṭasya vinirgatam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 e qual esce di cuor che si rammarca, 128 tal voce uscì del cielo e cotal disse: 129 «O navicella mia, com’ mal se’ carca!».
query.error: **English:** 127 and as a voice comes from a heart that grieves, 128 so a voice came from heaven and spoke these words: 129 "Oh my little ship, how heavily laden you are!"
query.result: 127 Yathā ca hṛdayāt kṣubdhāt vāṇī niḥsarati, 128 tathā vāṇī divyāt sthānāt niḥsṛtya evam avocat: 129 "He naurāja, katham adhika-bhāreṇa yuktā asi!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
130 Poi parve a me che la terra s’aprisse 131 tr’ambo le ruote, e vidi uscirne un drago 132 che per lo carro sù la coda fisse;
query.error: **English:** 130 Then it seemed to me that the earth opened up 131 between the two wheels, and I saw a dragon emerge 132 that fixed itself with its tail on the chariot;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
133 e come vespa che ritragge l’ago, 134 a sé traendo la coda maligna, 135 trasse del fondo, e gissen vago vago.
query.error: **English:** 133 and like a wasp that retracts its sting, 134 drawing its malicious tail back to itself, 135 it dragged itself out from the abyss and darted about.
query.result: 133 tathā ca yathā vṛścikaḥ śṛṅgaṃ samharati, 134 svaṃ puccham duṣṭaṃ svaṃ prati ākarṣan, 135 adhastāt kṛṣṭvā viṣamaṃ viṣamaṃ jagāma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
136 Quel che rimase, come da gramigna 137 vivace terra, da la piuma, offerta 138 forse con intenzion sana e benigna,
query.error: **English:** 136 That which remained, like quickening grass 137 from fertile soil, from feathers, offered 138 perhaps with good and kind intention,
query.result: 136 Yat kiñcid avekṣyate, yathā tr̥ṇam 137 jīvanti bhūmiḥ, pakṣāt, prayacchatā 138 śubhāśayena vā dayayā vā,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
139 si ricoperse, e funne ricoperta 140 e l’una e l’altra rota e ’l temo, in tanto 141 che più tiene un sospir la bocca aperta.
query.error: **English:** 139 covered itself, and both wheels and the axle were covered 140 so that a sigh keeps the mouth open longer.
query.result: 139 ācchādayām āsa, ācchāditā ca 140 ubhe cakre rathacakro nābhiś ca, yāvat 141 ekasya viśvāso 'pi mukham vivṛtam karoti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
142 Trasformato così ’l dificio santo 143 mise fuor teste per le parti sue, 144 tre sovra ’l temo e una in ciascun canto.
query.error: **English:** 142 Thus transformed, the holy structure 143 put forth heads throughout its parts, 144 three on the prow and one on each side.
query.result: 142 Tathā pariṇataḥ punar yaḥ pavitraḥ saṃsthānaṃ 143 Nijair angeṣu mūrdhāni prāduṣkurvāṇaḥ 144 Triṇi prāgagre ekaṃ ca pratyagre.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
145 Le prime eran cornute come bue, 146 ma le quattro un sol corno avean per fronte: 147 simile mostro visto ancor non fue.
query.error: **English:** 145 The first were horned like oxen, 146 but the four had a single horn on their foreheads: 147 such a monster was never seen before.
query.result: 145 Prathamāḥ śṛṅgitāḥ āsann iva gāvaḥ, 146 Catasṛṇām tu eka eva śṛṅgam āsīt agre: 147 Tādṛśam rakṣasam pūrvam na dṛṣṭam āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
148 Sicura, quasi rocca in alto monte, 149 seder sovresso una puttana sciolta 150 m’apparve con le ciglia intorno pronte;
query.error: **English:** 148 Secure, like a fortress on a high mountain, 149 sat above her a loose harlot, 150 who appeared to me with her eyebrows raised;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
151 e come perché non li fosse tolta, 152 vidi di costa a lei dritto un gigante; 153 e basciavansi insieme alcuna volta.
query.error: **English:** 151 and as if so that she would not be taken from him, 152 I saw a giant standing beside her; 153 and sometimes they would kiss each other.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
154 Ma perché l’occhio cupido e vagante 155 a me rivolse, quel feroce drudo 156 la flagellò dal capo infin le piante;
query.error: **English:** 154 But because my lustful and wandering eye 155 turned to me, that fierce lover 156 beat her from head to foot;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
157 poi, di sospetto pieno e d’ira crudo, 158 disciolse il mostro, e trassel per la selva, 159 tanto che sol di lei mi fece scudo
query.error: **English:** 157 then, full of suspicion and cruel with anger, 158 he loosed the monster, and dragged her through the wood, 159 so that he made her alone my shield
query.result: 157 Tataḥ saṃśayena pūrṇaḥ krodhena ca niruṇḍhaḥ, 158 Rakṣasaṃ vimucya vanaṃ prati apāyayat, 159 Yāvat sa eva me ekaḥ kavacaṃ babhūva

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
160 a la puttana e a la nova belva.
query.error: **English:** 160 against the harlot and the new beast.
query.result: 160 Veśyāyāḥ nava-paśavoś ca prati.
